trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory Editor
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory Editor

trans-unit.source: Describes the Azure Data Factory Editor, which allows you to create, edit, and deploy JSON definitions of linked services, tables, and pipelines using a light-weight web-based UI.
trans-unit.target: Describes the Azure Data Factory Editor, which allows you to create, edit, and deploy JSON definitions of linked services, tables, and pipelines using a light-weight web-based UI.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory Editor
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory Editor

trans-unit.source: The Azure Data Factory Editor is a light weight Web editor that is part of the Azure Preview Portal, which allows you to create, edit, and deploy JSON files of all Azure Data Factory entities.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Data Factory Editor is a light weight Web editor that is part of the Azure Preview Portal, which allows you to create, edit, and deploy JSON files of all Azure Data Factory entities.

trans-unit.source: This enables you to create linked services, data sets, and pipelines by using the JSON templates that ship with the Data Factory service.
trans-unit.target: This enables you to create linked services, data sets, and pipelines by using the JSON templates that ship with the Data Factory service.

trans-unit.source: If you are new PowerShell, this removes the need for installing and ramping up on Azure PowerShell to create Azure data factories.
trans-unit.target: If you are new PowerShell, this removes the need for installing and ramping up on Azure PowerShell to create Azure data factories.

trans-unit.source: Launching Data Factory Editor
trans-unit.target: Launching Data Factory Editor

trans-unit.source: To launch Data Factory Editor, click **Author & Deploy** tile on the **Data Factory** blade for your Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: To launch Data Factory Editor, click **Author & Deploy** tile on the **Data Factory** blade for your Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: Author and Deploy Tile
trans-unit.target: Author and Deploy Tile

trans-unit.source: You will see the Data Factory Editor as shown in the following image:
trans-unit.target: You will see the Data Factory Editor as shown in the following image:

trans-unit.source: Data Factory Editor
trans-unit.target: Data Factory Editor

trans-unit.source: Creating new linked services, data sets, and pipelines
trans-unit.target: Creating new linked services, data sets, and pipelines

trans-unit.source: There are four buttons on the toolbar that you can use to create Azure Data Factory entities.
trans-unit.target: There are four buttons on the toolbar that you can use to create Azure Data Factory entities.

trans-unit.source: **New data store** for creating a data store linked service.
trans-unit.target: **New data store** for creating a data store linked service.

trans-unit.source: When you click this button, you will see a menu with the following options: Azure storage, Azure SQL database, On-premises SQL server database.
trans-unit.target: When you click this button, you will see a menu with the following options: Azure storage, Azure SQL database, On-premises SQL server database.

trans-unit.source: **New compute** for creating a compute linked service.
trans-unit.target: **New compute** for creating a compute linked service.

trans-unit.source: When you click this button, you will see a menu with the following options: On-demand HDInsight cluster, HDInsight cluster, AzureML linked service.
trans-unit.target: When you click this button, you will see a menu with the following options: On-demand HDInsight cluster, HDInsight cluster, AzureML linked service.

trans-unit.source: **New dataset** for creating a dataset.
trans-unit.target: **New dataset** for creating a dataset.

trans-unit.source: When you click this button, you will see the following options: Blob table, Azure SQL table, On-premises table.
trans-unit.target: When you click this button, you will see the following options: Blob table, Azure SQL table, On-premises table.

trans-unit.source: **New pipeline** for creating a pipeline.
trans-unit.target: **New pipeline** for creating a pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Click **... (ellipsis)** on the toolbar if you do not see this button on the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: Click **... (ellipsis)** on the toolbar if you do not see this button on the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: To create a storage linked service
trans-unit.target: To create a storage linked service

trans-unit.source: Click **New data store**, and click one of the options in the menu.
trans-unit.target: Click **New data store**, and click one of the options in the menu.

trans-unit.source: New data store menu
trans-unit.target: New data store menu

trans-unit.source: You will see the JSON template for creating a storage linked service in the **Editor canvas** to the right.
trans-unit.target: You will see the JSON template for creating a storage linked service in the **Editor canvas** to the right.

trans-unit.source: You will also see that a draft node appears under **Drafts**.
trans-unit.target: You will also see that a draft node appears under **Drafts**.

trans-unit.source: Do the following:
trans-unit.target: Do the following:

trans-unit.source: For **Azure storage**: replace **<accountname\>** and **<accountkey\>** with name and key of your Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: For **Azure storage**: replace **<accountname\>** and **<accountkey\>** with name and key of your Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: For **Azure SQL database**: replace **<servername\>** with name of your Azure SQL server, **<databasename\>** with the name of the database, **<username\>@<servername\>** with the name of the user, and **<password\>** with the password for the user account.
trans-unit.target: For **Azure SQL database**: replace **<servername\>** with name of your Azure SQL server, **<databasename\>** with the name of the database, **<username\>@<servername\>** with the name of the user, and **<password\>** with the password for the user account.

trans-unit.source: For **On-premises SQL server database**: replace **<servername\>** with name of your on-premises SQL server, **<databasename\>** with the name of the database, **<username\>** with the name of the user, and **<password\>** with the password for the user account.
trans-unit.target: For **On-premises SQL server database**: replace **<servername\>** with name of your on-premises SQL server, **<databasename\>** with the name of the database, **<username\>** with the name of the user, and **<password\>** with the password for the user account.

trans-unit.source: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to deploy the linked service.
trans-unit.target: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to deploy the linked service.

trans-unit.source: You can click **Discard** to discoard the JSON draft you created.
trans-unit.target: You can click **Discard** to discoard the JSON draft you created.

trans-unit.source: Deploy button
trans-unit.target: Deploy button

trans-unit.source: You should see the status of the Deploy operation on the title bar.
trans-unit.target: You should see the status of the Deploy operation on the title bar.

trans-unit.source: Deploy success message
trans-unit.target: Deploy success message

trans-unit.source: If the deploy operation is successful, you should see the created linked service in the tree view to the left.
trans-unit.target: If the deploy operation is successful, you should see the created linked service in the tree view to the left.

trans-unit.source: StorageLinkedService in tree view
trans-unit.target: StorageLinkedService in tree view

trans-unit.source: To create a compute linked service
trans-unit.target: To create a compute linked service

trans-unit.source: Click **New compute** and click one of the options in the menu.
trans-unit.target: Click **New compute** and click one of the options in the menu.

trans-unit.source: New compute menu
trans-unit.target: New compute menu

trans-unit.source: You will see the JSON template for creating a compute linked service in the Editor canvas to the right.
trans-unit.target: You will see the JSON template for creating a compute linked service in the Editor canvas to the right.

trans-unit.source: Do the following:
trans-unit.target: Do the following:

trans-unit.source: For **On-demand HDInsight cluster**, specify values for the following properties:
trans-unit.target: For **On-demand HDInsight cluster**, specify values for the following properties:

trans-unit.source: For the **clusterSize** property, specify the size of the HDInsight cluster you want the Data Factory service to create at runtime.
trans-unit.target: For the **clusterSize** property, specify the size of the HDInsight cluster you want the Data Factory service to create at runtime.

trans-unit.source: For the **jobsContainer** property, specify the name of the default blob container where you want the cluster logs will be stored.
trans-unit.target: For the **jobsContainer** property, specify the name of the default blob container where you want the cluster logs will be stored.

trans-unit.source: For the **timeToLive** property, specify the allowed idle time before the HDInsight cluster is deleted.
trans-unit.target: For the **timeToLive** property, specify the allowed idle time before the HDInsight cluster is deleted.

trans-unit.source: For example: 00:05:00 indicates that the cluster should be be deleted after 5 minutes of idle time.
trans-unit.target: For example: 00:05:00 indicates that the cluster should be be deleted after 5 minutes of idle time.

trans-unit.source: For the **version** property, specify HDInsight version for the cluster (default: version 3.1).
trans-unit.target: For the **version** property, specify HDInsight version for the cluster (default: version 3.1).

trans-unit.source: For the **linkedServiceName** property, specify the Azure storage linked service to be associated with the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: For the **linkedServiceName** property, specify the Azure storage linked service to be associated with the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For **HDInsight cluster** (Bring-your-own), specify values for the following properties:
trans-unit.target: For **HDInsight cluster** (Bring-your-own), specify values for the following properties:

trans-unit.source: For the **clusterUri** property, specify the URL for your own HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: For the **clusterUri** property, specify the URL for your own HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For the **userName** property, specify the user account that the Data Factory service should use to connect to your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: For the **userName** property, specify the user account that the Data Factory service should use to connect to your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For the **password** property, specify the password for the user account.
trans-unit.target: For the **password** property, specify the password for the user account.

trans-unit.source: For the **linkedServiceName** property, specify the Azure storage linked service that is associated with yhour HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: For the **linkedServiceName** property, specify the Azure storage linked service that is associated with yhour HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For **AzureML linked service**, specify the following properties:
trans-unit.target: For **AzureML linked service**, specify the following properties:

trans-unit.source: for the **mlEndPoint** property, specify the Azure Machine Learning batch scoring URL.
trans-unit.target: for the **mlEndPoint** property, specify the Azure Machine Learning batch scoring URL.

trans-unit.source: for the **apiKey** property, specify the API key for the published workspace model.
trans-unit.target: for the **apiKey** property, specify the API key for the published workspace model.

trans-unit.source: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to deploy the linked service.
trans-unit.target: Click **Deploy** on the toolbar to deploy the linked service.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] See the [Linked Services][msdn-linkedservices-reference] topic in MSDN Library for descriptions of JSON elements that are used to define an Azure Data Factory linked service..
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] See the [Linked Services][msdn-linkedservices-reference] topic in MSDN Library for descriptions of JSON elements that are used to define an Azure Data Factory linked service..

trans-unit.source: To create a new dataset
trans-unit.target: To create a new dataset

trans-unit.source: Click **New dataset** and click one of the options in the menu.
trans-unit.target: Click **New dataset** and click one of the options in the menu.

trans-unit.source: You will see the JSON template for creating a dataset in the Editor canvas to the right.
trans-unit.target: You will see the JSON template for creating a dataset in the Editor canvas to the right.

trans-unit.source: Do the following:
trans-unit.target: Do the following:

trans-unit.source: For **Blob table**, specify values for the following properties:
trans-unit.target: For **Blob table**, specify values for the following properties:

trans-unit.source: For **Azure SQL table** or **On-premises table**, specify values for the following properties:
trans-unit.target: For **Azure SQL table** or **On-premises table**, specify values for the following properties:

trans-unit.source: In the **location** section:
trans-unit.target: In the **location** section:

trans-unit.source: For the **linkedServiceName** property, specify the name of the linked service that referes to your Azure SQL/On-premises SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: For the **linkedServiceName** property, specify the name of the linked service that referes to your Azure SQL/On-premises SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: For the **tableName** property, specify the name of the table in the Azure SQL Database instance/On-premises SQL server that the linked service referes to.
trans-unit.target: For the **tableName** property, specify the name of the table in the Azure SQL Database instance/On-premises SQL server that the linked service referes to.

trans-unit.source: In the **availability** section:
trans-unit.target: In the **availability** section:

trans-unit.source: For the **frequency** property, specify the time unit for data slice production.
trans-unit.target: For the **frequency** property, specify the time unit for data slice production.

trans-unit.source: The supported frequency values:Minute, Hour, Day, Week, Month.
trans-unit.target: The supported frequency values:Minute, Hour, Day, Week, Month.

trans-unit.source: For the **interval** property, specify the interval within the defined frequency.
trans-unit.target: For the **interval** property, specify the interval within the defined frequency.

trans-unit.source: **frequency** set to **Hour** and **interval** set to **1** indicates that new data slices should be produced hourly.
trans-unit.target: **frequency** set to **Hour** and **interval** set to **1** indicates that new data slices should be produced hourly.

trans-unit.source: In the **structure** section:
trans-unit.target: In the **structure** section:

trans-unit.source: specify names and types of columns as shown in the following example:
trans-unit.target: specify names and types of columns as shown in the following example:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] See the [Tables][msdn-tables-reference] topic in MSDN Library for descriptions of JSON elements that are used to define an Azure Data Factory table.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] See the [Tables][msdn-tables-reference] topic in MSDN Library for descriptions of JSON elements that are used to define an Azure Data Factory table.

trans-unit.source: To create and activate a pipeline
trans-unit.target: To create and activate a pipeline

trans-unit.source: Click **New pipeline** on the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: Click **New pipeline** on the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: If you do not see the **New pipeline** button, click **...(ellipsis)** to see it.
trans-unit.target: If you do not see the **New pipeline** button, click **...(ellipsis)** to see it.

trans-unit.source: You will see the JSON template for creating a pipeline in the Editor canvas to the right.
trans-unit.target: You will see the JSON template for creating a pipeline in the Editor canvas to the right.

trans-unit.source: Do the following:
trans-unit.target: Do the following:

trans-unit.source: For the **description** property, specify description for the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: For the **description** property, specify description for the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: For the **activities** section, add activities to the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: For the **activities** section, add activities to the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: For the **start** property, specify when data processing starts or the data slices will be processed.
trans-unit.target: For the **start** property, specify when data processing starts or the data slices will be processed.

trans-unit.source: For the **end** property, specify when data processing ends.
trans-unit.target: For the **end** property, specify when data processing ends.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] See the [Pipelines and Activities][msdn-pipelines-reference] topic in MSDN Library for descriptions of JSON elements that are used to define an Azure Data Factory pipeline.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] See the [Pipelines and Activities][msdn-pipelines-reference] topic in MSDN Library for descriptions of JSON elements that are used to define an Azure Data Factory pipeline.

trans-unit.source: To add an activity definition to a pipeline JSON
trans-unit.target: To add an activity definition to a pipeline JSON

trans-unit.source: You can add an activity definition to a pipeline JSON by clicking **Add Activity** on the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: You can add an activity definition to a pipeline JSON by clicking **Add Activity** on the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: When you click this button, you choose the type of activity that you want to be added to the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: When you click this button, you choose the type of activity that you want to be added to the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Add Activity options
trans-unit.target: Add Activity options

trans-unit.source: If you want to copy data from an Azure SQL database to Azure blob storage and process the data in the blob storage by using Pig script on a HDInsight cluster, you first add a **Copy activity** and then add a **Pig activity** to the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: If you want to copy data from an Azure SQL database to Azure blob storage and process the data in the blob storage by using Pig script on a HDInsight cluster, you first add a **Copy activity** and then add a **Pig activity** to the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: This creates two sections with in the activities[] section of the pipeline JSON.
trans-unit.target: This creates two sections with in the activities[] section of the pipeline JSON.

trans-unit.source: Pig activity is nothing but the HDInsight Activity with Pig transformation.
trans-unit.target: Pig activity is nothing but the HDInsight Activity with Pig transformation.

trans-unit.source: Starting a pipeline
trans-unit.target: Starting a pipeline

trans-unit.source: You can specify the start date-time and end date-time for a pipeline by specifying values for the start and end properties in the JSON.
trans-unit.target: You can specify the start date-time and end date-time for a pipeline by specifying values for the start and end properties in the JSON.

trans-unit.source: Drafts in the editor
trans-unit.target: Drafts in the editor

trans-unit.source: Drafts allows you to temporarily save your work when you are context switching or navigating to a different entity in the Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: Drafts allows you to temporarily save your work when you are context switching or navigating to a different entity in the Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: The lifetime of the Drafts is associated with the browser session.
trans-unit.target: The lifetime of the Drafts is associated with the browser session.

trans-unit.source: If you close the browser or use another machine, the drafts are not going to be available.
trans-unit.target: If you close the browser or use another machine, the drafts are not going to be available.

trans-unit.source: To discard a JSON draft of a Data Factory entity
trans-unit.target: To discard a JSON draft of a Data Factory entity

trans-unit.source: You can discard the JSON definition of an Azure Data Factory entity by clicking **Discard** button on the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: You can discard the JSON definition of an Azure Data Factory entity by clicking **Discard** button on the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: To clone a Data Factory entity
trans-unit.target: To clone a Data Factory entity

trans-unit.source: You can clone an existing Azure Data Factory entity (linked service, table, or pipeline) by selecting the entity in the tree view and clicking the **Clone** button on the toolbar.
trans-unit.target: You can clone an existing Azure Data Factory entity (linked service, table, or pipeline) by selecting the entity in the tree view and clicking the **Clone** button on the toolbar.

trans-unit.source: Clone data factory entity
trans-unit.target: Clone data factory entity

trans-unit.source: You will see a new draft created under **Drafts** node in the tree view.
trans-unit.target: You will see a new draft created under **Drafts** node in the tree view.

trans-unit.source: To delete a Data Factory entity
trans-unit.target: To delete a Data Factory entity

trans-unit.source: You can delete an Azure Data Factory entity (linked service, table, or pipeline), select the entity in the tree view and click **Delete** on the toolbar (or) right-click the entity and click **Delete**.
trans-unit.target: You can delete an Azure Data Factory entity (linked service, table, or pipeline), select the entity in the tree view and click **Delete** on the toolbar (or) right-click the entity and click **Delete**.

trans-unit.source: Delete data factory entity
trans-unit.target: Delete data factory entity

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: See the [Get started with Azure Data Factory][data-factory-get-started] topic for step-by-step instructions to create an Azure data factory by using the Data Factory Editor.
trans-unit.target: See the [Get started with Azure Data Factory][data-factory-get-started] topic for step-by-step instructions to create an Azure data factory by using the Data Factory Editor.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
